name: Hotel Guanamar

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: While this hotel is in an excellent location and the staff are nice, the brochures are definitely not realistic. There is no hot water, no 24 hour security, and no working pool. There were no stairs from our room to the lobby area after our first night ... they took these stairs down with electric saws at 6 am. We had to climb up a mud path to get to the lobby. The rooms are in no way decorated, and the "satellite TV" is a five channel postage stamp. The air condition unit has one level: extremely loud or off. The breakfast was nothing to write home about. They also charge you to use the safety deposit box. We did have a very nice cat hang out at our back porch, and the rooms were pretty clean. couple dead cockroaches and 5 or 6 millipedes running around- but that's costa rica. I wouldn't pay more than 40 bucks a night for this place- it has definitely seen better days. Must have been nice when it was first built.
reviews.title: make sure you don't pay full price

reviews.text: Erika was extremely friendly along with the rest of the staff. The thatched roofs and upkept grounds really added alot. Food was good. King bed was wonderful. Absolutley no complaints and would stay here again. Okay, there's one minor..get internet in the rooms, did work in the lobby. I had the most awesome sunset there! Wish I would have stayed longer. Big plus..It's located right next to my favorite beach.
reviews.title: The Sunset!!

reviews.text: This is the place to stay if you want a beautiful ocean view above one of the most beautiful beaches is Costa Rica.
reviews.title: Great views above Playa Carrillo

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here for 3 nights and loved it. The staff is so friendly and helpful, the view is amazing and so are the sunsets, the food and drinks were delicious and the rooms are very spacious and comfortable. I would highly recommend anyone stay here during their trip to Playa Carrillo!
reviews.title: Wonderful place to stay!!!

reviews.text: We visited Hotel Guanamar from March 2-8, 2006 when the dry season was at it's peak. Even though it was considered to be very hot and dry to most locals, we (being Floridians) found it very lush and completely tolerable in terms of the heat. The evenings are perfect for sitting in an open air restaurant, of which there are many in the area, and enjoy the comfortable weather without mosquitos and other biting insects.
reviews.title: Hotel Guanamar-Southland Hotels

reviews.text: Hotel Guanamar has the best view of Playa Carrillo, my favorite beach in Costa Rica. It's a shame that the hotel is not properly maintained. If the rooms were slightly cleaner and more comfortable, it would have an excellent rating. As it is, it's a good deal for the wonderful view. The restaurant is ok. The employees are not well trained so don't expect much in the way of service; however, the hotel is excellently located and quiet. The airconditioning in the room worked very well.
reviews.title: Best View Hotel, needs improvement

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I did extensive research on Costa Rica, and especially this area. The hotel was nice, the food was above average, and the staff were friendly. The sunsets, as everyone has said, are really beautiful. Hotel is rated at a 3 star, and I would say this is correct. It is definitely not ultra luxurious, but it doesnt pretend to be. Alot of people on Trip Advisor has said that place was dirty...untrue. The grounds were very kept, and nice. The restaurant and bar area are outside, under really nice palm thatched roofs...really cool. Rooms were basic, but clean, and we were barely in them. Only issue is the TV was sub par, but if you watching TV on your trip, you are doing something wrong. Make sure you get an oceanfront..totally worth the extra money.
reviews.title: Very nice hotel...would recommend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Samara and Carrillo beaches are beautiful and we would definitely go back. Make sure you rent a 4x4. if you are adventurous and want to explore, you will need one. Most of the roads are dirt, and impassable with a car. Wingnuts canopy tour was great, and I would recommend this too. Use SPF 50 or you will burn. Go to Costa Rica with some knowledge of Spanish. Alot of people do not speak english, and they definitely respect you more if you try to speak their language.
reviews.title: We loved it.
Fishing in Playa Carillo
reviews.text: I would point out that the last two contributors had only one review apiece...suspect....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The pool was delightful, see the pics. The room was clean , modern, and functional but lacking a fridge. You may borrow a cooler at the office.
reviews.title: DO NOT STAY HERE, BE AWARE !!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Please don't ever trust on the photos they have online, NOT REAL!!! That was my first time in the hotel but not in Carrillo beach (which is awesome by the way). My boyfriend and I wanted to find something beautiful to spend our new year's eve, so we used the internet of course and trusted on the pics they have but we face another reality when we got there. First of all, it took us 1 whole hour to wait for them to give us our room. While waiting, a pigeon defecated on my shoulder! The hotel's lobby made of dried palms and wood was full of doves and pigeons! When we got to our room, all furniture was amazingly old, damaged and stained, the two 70's-style bathrooms had a huge tree trunk terribly inserted in the middle of the bathtub giving it a poor, disgusting sensation. Besides, the entrance to the rooms is gloomy, dark, empty! It seems you are in an abandoned house instead of a hotel! However, the worst part was that, after taking a shower in such awful conditions, we found a big centipede in the bathroom and a scorpion under the bed!!!! Of course, we asked the hotel to move us immediately to another room and they did so. The new room was not that terrible, at least a little bit newer, but nothing as expected. Besides, everything is dead after 10 pm. The rate was ridiculously expensive!!! Even more expensive than an al-inclusive hotel.
reviews.title: SCARED!!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We parked our rented car, we checked in and we were invited to visit the restaurant and swimming pool while our room was being prepared. It took us 20 minutes and when we returned, they had broken the car´s door and they had stolen our passports, credit cards, money, license, personal belongings, camera and our hotel and flight tickets. We spent the whole afternoon at a Costa Rican Investigation Organization and when we returned I asked to talk to the managed, who told me that since they had never had an experience as ours, they would not consider themselves liable for the robbery inside their hotel! They even would not let us spend the night there, because our hotel tickets had been reported robbed! On their faces!! It was only us in the hotel when we were robbed, it is imposible to think nobody realised they were stealing! We had to travel to our Embassy to have our passports done to leave Costa Rica the day after. Awful
reviews.title: The worst experience ever. We were robbed inside de hotel and nobody cared

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We loved the ocean view rooms and the higher panoramic views from the bar and restaurant. A beautiful breeze up here also in the daytime. Best for people with agility as its 55 steps up from the oceanview rooms to the bar/restuarant/pool. Its also a 2 minute downhill walk to Carrillo, which is arguably the best beach in the country. The rooms are basic but clean and large, but noisy AC. The staff are supernice. Meals here are good, but not as cheap as Samara restaurants. For example, Dorado is usually $10 in town, but $14 here. If Leyenda will give you a free pickup and dropoff (tip the driver) definitely go to their fantastic restaurant in the hotel. Best food around, and not expensive. This hotel gives 20% off if you stay at least 7 days. Breakfast is included. Bus to Samara is 300 colones (60 cents)
reviews.title: Fantastic views from bar/restaurant and rooms

reviews.text: This was our first time to Costa Rica and my first time traveling with my friend. Given that we don't speak Spanish well and are two females, we were very cautious with our choices to stay. After seeing the great price on hotels's website, we could not help but give this place a try.
reviews.title: Pleasantly Surprised

reviews.text: We were very pleasantly surprised by the location and views to be at this hotel. The staffs were very nice and even offered the off-beaten path to a local attraction: natural water pool (be cautious of high tides times & don't get stuck when it comes). The room was basic but the view compensated for what the room lacked. Yes, the air conditioner is loud, but try sleeping with the sound of the waves when it is not too hot or humid. Yes, you will see ants but don't leave stuff out that will attract them.
reviews.title: Beautiful view and spacious rooms

reviews.text: I stayed 3 nights at Guanamar and it totally met my expectations. They are located just up the hill at the south end of Playa Carrillo, as there development on the beach is prohibited - which is what makes Carrillo so nice. The rooms we had were down the hill from the pool and restaurant with a great view of the ocean. The view of sunsets from the pool deck can not be beat - awesome! The staff was very friendly. The rooms were big with plenty of hot water pressure in the shower and the A/C worked great. A typical Costa Rican buffet breakfast was included - eggs, gallo pinto, fruit and pancakes. I love Carrillo because the beach is quieter and you are only 5km from Samara, which has more restaurants and bars. I was able to take advantage of a discount coupon on the rate, so the value was excellent. Would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Wonderful sunsets, pool, rooms and service

reviews.text: This is definitely not a luxury hotel but has all you need to enjoy a nice vacation time: good service, delicious food, kind people, large and quiet rooms - some of them with a stunning ocean view from the balcony - and it is less than 5 minutes walking from the beautiful Carrillo beach.
reviews.title: Warm and comfortable with a great service!

reviews.text: Breakfast was included with the room and consisted of season fruits, eggs, bread, coffee, cheese, bacon and gallo pinto.
reviews.title: I really enjoyed this hotel. Enjoy it

reviews.text: The pool and bar areas are not large but are charming, you can enjoy the sunset comfortably sited in there.
reviews.title: Best view in the area

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you are not used to walk, you better use a car to get from the hotel to the beach because the hotel is located in a small mountain that can be hard. Same for the rooms that are far from the restaurant, pool or front desk.
reviews.title: GOOD TIMES....

description: Guanamar is a three star family hotel in Playa Carrillo Costa Rica in Guanacaste province which has been operating for the last 25 years in the North Pacific coast of Costa Rica, near the warm waters of Pacific ocean.It just 2 miles from Playa Samara. The hotel is surrounded by the rich and exuberant flora and fauna typical from the area. Guanamar is perfectly situated on the hill top at the southern end of the bay, inviting guests to enjoy the spectacular panoramic views and sunsets. Guanamar is located close to samara beach hotels (4miles) and just 1 mile from local airport (samara airport).
